title: What is the symbolic relationship between the wolf and the sun god Belen or Apollo among the Celts and Greeks?
first_phrase: This text explores the symbolism of the wolf in both Celtic and Greek mythology, including its relationship with the sun god, Belen or Apollo. The discussion moves on to the transition of the term sapta-riksha from the Big Dipper to the Pleiades, which corresponds to a change from solstice to equinox symbolism. In the last 200 tokens, the text discusses the confusion that can arise from the application of different names to different celestial bodies but argues that these can be resolved by examining the traditional forms to which they correspond. The text ends with a comparison of the Greek myth of the Calydonian boar hunt with the Hindu tradition's iveta-varciba.
